item.title: 尽管阿布扎比掀起上市热潮，但绿色电力公司仍希望保持私有化
item.description: 阿布扎比最大的可再生能源公司首席执行官表示，尽管该地区的首次公开募股热潮正在兴起，但他更倾向于暂时保持私有化，因为公司资金充足。【原文：The chief executive officer of Abu Dhabi’s largest renewables company said he prefers to stay private for now because the company is well funded — despite the regional boom in initial public offerings.】

item.title: 南非通胀率攀升，降低降息几率
item.description: 南非的通胀率在 7 月份升至 10 个月来的新高，这降低了决策者在下个月召开会议时再次降息的可能性。【原文：South African inflation quickened to a 10-month high in July, reducing the chance of another interest-rate cut when policymakers meet next month.】

item.title: 捷克反对党承诺若赢得大选将结束紧缩政策
item.description: 一个反对党的高级官员表示，捷克共和国必须放弃 "财政自责 "的嗜好，转而投资于经济增长，该反对党有望在 10 月份的选举中大获全胜。【原文：The Czech Republic must drop its penchant for “fiscal self-flagellation” in favor of investing in economic growth, according to a senior official from an opposition party poised to sweep to victory in October elections.】

item.title: 这就是初创企业死亡的后果
item.description:
一家小公司如何拔掉插头？【原文：

How a small company pulls the plug.

】

item.title: 奇货可居：这就是初创企业死亡的后果（播客）
item.description: 你总能听到初创企业退出的消息。大收购。大型 IPO。但当然，大多数新创企业的命运并非如此。它们中的许多会彻底消亡，股东根本没有任何 "退出 "的机会。那么，怎样才能结束一家公司的生命，卖掉残羹剩饭呢？怎样才能真正拔掉插头？Resolution Financial Advisors 公司的戴维-约翰逊（David Johnson）正是这方面的专家。由于正式的破产程序非常昂贵，许多公司都在寻找通过资产出售来挽回价值的方法。【原文：You always hear about startup exits. Big acquisitions. Big IPOs. But of course, this isn’t the fate for most new ventures. Many of them die outright, without any kind of “exit” at all for shareholders. So how do you wind down a company, and sell off the scraps? How do you actually pull the plug? David Johnson of Resolution Financial Advisors specializes in exactly that. Because the formal bankruptcy process is very expensive, many companies look for some way to salvage value by doing an asset fi】

item.title: 据说沙特阿拉伯承包商 MGC 正在探索利雅得上市事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，沙特阿拉伯的 Mutlaq AlGhowairi Contracting Co. 公司正在考虑在利雅得进行首次公开募股。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s Mutlaq AlGhowairi Contracting Co. is weighing an initial public offering in Riyadh, according to people familiar with the matter, which could add to a wave of listings in the kingdom that’ve raised over $10 billion in the last two years.】

item.title: 拉加德认为经济增长放缓，贸易不确定性依然存在
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德表示，尽管最近与美国达成的协议减少了不确定性，但全球贸易仍存在问号，欧元区经济本季度的增长可能放缓。【原文：The euro-zone economy is likely to see slower growth this quarter, with question marks over global trade remaining despite recent deals with the US reducing uncertainty, European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said.】

item.title: 新西兰央行出人意料的鸽派政策推升了债券交易商的陡峭化押注
item.description: 进行所谓陡峭化交易的全球债券基金刚刚得到了新西兰储备银行的帮助。【原文：Global bond funds making so-called steepening trades just got a helping hand from the Reserve Bank of New Zealand.】

item.title: 肯尼亚考虑将最大的上市公司拆分为三个单位
item.description: 肯尼亚政府正在考虑将该国最大的上市公司 Safaricom Plc 分成三个部门。【原文：Kenya’s government is considering separating the nation’s biggest listed company — Safaricom Plc — into three units.】

item.title: 新加坡淡马锡考虑进行重大改革以提高回报率
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，淡马锡控股私人有限公司（Temasek Holdings Pte）正在酝酿多年来最大的一次改革，可能将公司重组为三个投资工具，以提高回报和效率。【原文：Temasek Holdings Pte is mulling one of its biggest overhauls in years, potentially reorganizing the firm into three investment vehicles in a bid to boost returns and efficiencies, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 印尼在实现普拉博沃增长目标的同时加大宽松力度，令人惊喜
item.description: 印尼央行连续第二个月下调基准利率，进一步将货币政策转向促进经济增长，令市场大吃一惊。【原文：Indonesia’s central bank surprised markets by cutting its benchmark rate for a second straight month, further shifting monetary policy toward boosting economic growth.】

item.title: 瑞典央行维持利率不变，但仍发出今年降息的信号
item.description: 瑞典中央银行保持利率稳定，以抵御近期通胀率的飙升，并重申今年晚些时候降息的可能性，以支持陷入困境的经济。【原文：Sweden’s central bank kept interest rates steady to parry a recent spike in inflation and reiterated the prospect of a cut later this year to support a struggling economy.】

item.title: 美国科技股大跌，欧洲股市下跌
item.description: 由于美国重量级科技股大幅下挫，市场情绪受到影响，欧洲股市下跌。【原文：European stocks fell as a sharp selloff in technology heavyweights in the US weighed on market sentiment.】

item.title: 印度寻求禁止在线博彩应用程序以遏制沉迷和欺诈行为
item.description: 由于通过这些应用程序上瘾、洗钱和金融诈骗的情况日益增多，印度已立法禁止网络货币游戏。【原文：India has moved a legislation to ban online money gaming due to rising instances of addiction, money laundering and financial frauds through these apps.】

item.title: 土耳其航空公司将收购西班牙欧罗巴航空公司的少数股份
item.description: 土耳其航空公司（Turkish Airlines）将收购西班牙运营商欧洲航空公司（Air Europa）的少数股份，投资额达 3 亿欧元（3.49 亿美元），展示了该航空公司的增长计划。【原文：Turkish Airlines is acquiring a minority stake in Spanish operator Air Europa involving an investment of €300 million ($349 million), showcasing the carrier’s plans for growth.】

item.title: 丹麦经济在制药商带动下反弹增长
item.description: 丹麦经济在第二季度出现反弹，原因是整个制药行业的强劲表现帮助抵消了诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk A/S）减肥药热销所带来的影响。【原文：Denmark’s economy rebounded in the second quarter, as the strength of the broader pharmaceuticals industry helped to outweigh the impact of weaker sales of Novo Nordisk A/S’s blockbuster weight-loss drugs.】

item.title: SBB 租金收入超出预期，首席执行官指出将实现扭亏为盈
item.description: SBB 是两年前瑞典房地产危机的中心，由于住宅业务的增长，该公司第二季度的租金收入好于预期。【原文：SBB, the firm at the center of Sweden’s property crisis two years ago, reported better-than-expected rental income in the second quarter thanks to growth in its residential segment.】

item.title: SQM 第二季度盈利因锂行业困境而下降
item.description: SQM 是世界顶级锂生产商之一，第二季度核心盈利下滑，电池材料价格跌至多年低点。【原文：SQM, one of the world’s top lithium producers, posted a slump in core earnings for the second quarter, when prices for the battery material crashed to multi-year lows.】

item.title: 英国 7 月通胀加速至 18 个月高点
item.description: 英国 7 月份通胀率连续第二个月攀升，这给英国央行重新考虑降息步伐增加了压力。【原文：UK inflation climbed for a second month in July, adding pressure on the Bank of England to reconsider its pace of interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 邦吉公司（Bunge）以质量为由让驶往中国的阿根廷豆粕船改道
item.description: 知情人士称，由于担心阿根廷豆粕可能不符合中国的质量标准，Bunge Global SA 将一批运往中国的阿根廷豆粕转运至东南亚。【原文：Bunge Global SA diverted a cargo of Argentine soybean meal bound for China to Southeast Asia due to concerns it might fail to meet Chinese quality specifications, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 外国人连续七个月买入超长期日本国债
item.description: 在高利率的诱惑下，购买日本超长期国债的海外投资者连续第七个月扩大购买规模，其购买总量创下了 1-7 月份的新高。【原文：Overseas investors in Japanese ultra-long-term government bonds extended their purchasing spree to a seventh straight month and lured by high interest rates, their aggregate buying struck a new peak in the January-July period.】

item.title: 阿联酋的可再生能源冠军将数十亿美元氢能资金转向数据繁荣
item.description: 阿布扎比的主要可再生能源公司已将用于绿色氢能的数十亿美元投资转用于推动阿布扎比酋长国的人工智能发展，这反映了曾被视为能源转型关键的燃料如何因缺乏买家而迫使公司重新评估计划。【原文：Abu Dhabi’s main renewables company has diverted billions of dollars of investment intended for green hydrogen toward powering the emirate’s AI push, reflecting how a lack of buyers for a fuel once seen as key for the energy transition is forcing firms to reassess plans.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国 7 月通胀率升幅高于预期
简街事件后，Citadel Securities 扩展印度团队
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，亿万富翁肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）的 Citadel Securities 公司本周已在印度聘用了一名期权交易员，并计划增加更多员工，以加强其在南亚国家的业务。【原文：Billionaire Ken Griffin’s Citadel Securities has hired an options trader in India this week and plans to add more staff to bolster its operations in the South Asian nation, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 鲍威尔在杰克逊霍尔的最后一搏
item.description:
美联储主席可能拥有制高点，但卡斯特也是如此。【原文：

The Fed chair may have the high ground, but so did Custer. 

】

item.title: Grab 票价突破 1,000 美元令新加坡打车用户震惊
item.description: 周三，新加坡的打车应用价格比平时飙升了约 100 倍，市内短途旅行的费用高达 1,000 美元或更多，这让新加坡的打车用户大吃一惊。【原文：Singapore ride-hailing users got a rude shock on Wednesday after prices on the most popular app jumped about a hundred times from the usual rates, with short trips within the city costing $1,000 or more.】

item.title: 南非推动规则审查，放宽星链入境限制
item.description: 南非电信部长表示，南非正在优先考虑一项政策审查程序，该程序可能导致埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）和其他卫星互联网公司获准在不出让所有权的情况下在非洲最大的经济体开展业务。【原文：South Africa is prioritizing a policy-review process that may result in Elon Musk’s SpaceX and other satellite-internet companies being allowed to operate in Africa’s largest economy without ceding ownership, the nation’s telecoms minister said.】

item.title: 瑞典初创企业 Mindler 同意收购英国 Ieso 数字健康公司
item.description: 瑞典初创公司 Mindler AB 收购了英国 Ieso Digital Health 公司，收购金额尚未披露，该公司正努力扩大其在在线治疗市场的影响力。【原文：Swedish startup Mindler AB has acquired Ieso Digital Health UK for an undisclosed sum as it seeks to build out its footprint in the online therapy market.】

item.title: 泰国央行称只有在经济增长前景黯淡时才会采取更多宽松政策
item.description: 一位高级官员表示，泰国央行需要看到其经济增长前景出现 "重大实质性恶化"，或者面临意想不到的冲击，才有理由在今年三次降息之后继续降息。【原文：Thailand’s central bank would need to see a “significant material deterioration” in its economic growth outlook, or face unexpected shocks, to justify additional rate cuts beyond the three reductions it has made this year, a top official said.】

item.title: 中国需求强劲，老铺黄金公司收入和利润增长超预期
item.description: 老铺黄金有限公司上半年的收入和利润增长超过预期，因为这家中国珠宝商的产品融合了传统工艺和丰富的文化图案，在中国中产阶级购物者中大受欢迎。【原文：Laopu Gold Co.’s revenue and profit growth topped estimates in the first half as the Chinese jeweler’s pieces, which blend traditional craftsmanship with rich cultural motifs, soar in popularity among middle class Chinese shoppers.】
